title: Towers were never good. What you remember is slightly different, but it highlights a real issue.
body:
When you reminisce for the good old days when towers were useful for something other than vision and cheap teleports, what you are actually remembering is a time when if your opponent(s) wanted to dive you, they had to walk in, start hitting you, fight you, eventually kill you, then walk out. This put them at risk.

 What happens today is that they dash in, kill you 70-0 instantly, then blink back out, taking maybe one tower shot.

 Towers have always sucked. Mobility creep in this game, however, is better described as mobility leap. THAT is the problem, and THAT is what Riot should be tasked with addressing.

 Solutions?

 For starters, champions mid-dash who are hit with snares and the like should stop instantly, rather than completing their dash first (wasting cc time, and also probably killing you anyway). Reacting in time should be rewarded. Jumps with weird trajectories such as Tristana's should drop them to the "ground" appropriately.

 Movement slows slow movement. It holds that movement slows should slow movement abilities. If Riven (for instance) is under a 30% slow, her Q animations finish 30% slower. Also, damage happens at the end of the animation, as you would expect. This opens up counterplay by allowing the player to use their slow to actually dodge the deluge of hypermobile champions currently warping the game. As it is, slow fields and effects are mostly inconsequential.

 Lastly, when Riot says that champions pay for their mobility, they should actually mean it. Evelynn pays for her stealth. Mobile champs pay nothing for their mobility (quite often literally).

Towers were good at one point. You actually had to juggle aggro if you did a dive. No one complained then because if you died under tower, it was due to the enemy skill and teamwork. Now it's a complete joke. The squishiest champs on the rift can solo tower dive at will with no fear at all.

When was this? I don't remember any time that I've been playing this game when towers were a real threat. I remember playing like they were, but that was just because I was bad. They never actually got nerfed. I mean that literally. There is no patch where towers have gotten a damage reduction.

Seriously, what patch were they good in and when did it end? I legitimately can't see it in their balance history. I think it's nostalgia for a time when people didn't realize how easy diving was.
Season 2/3

Definitely not. They sucked even worse back then. All turrets got their damage buffed in patches 3.05 and 4.11 because they sucked so much, and they never got their damage nerfed. They've never had their damage decreased. Seriously, it never happened. Look at the patch notes. I can't see any patch where tower damage got nerfed. It actually doesn't exist, and I don't think there's anything else that would have made towers so much weaker between then and now.

I'm completely convinced this is all just because people used to be bad at this game. People remember not getting dived because they and their opponents were worse at the game, so they weren't competent enough to dive the turrets. People have gotten better in the seasons since, so they actually dive people.

You sir are correct. There have never been nerfs to towers on Summoner's Rift. So I guess you were correct on the nostalgia and not diving correctly. Twisted Treeline did get significant nerfs on it's towers, so that's probably what I was thinking of. >  Lastly, when Riot says that champions pay for their mobility, they should actually mean it. Evelynn pays for her stealth. Mobile champs pay nothing for their mobility (quite often literally).

This is the absolute truth right now. Very well said.

People always tell me mobile champions do pay for their mobility, but in the case of champions like Riven, it's sometimes hard to decide what she pays for her high levels of mobility. Damage? She has truckloads. Durability? One of her mobility spells has a shield (albeit with short duration, but if you fail to dodge that skillshot you block its damage). Mana? Naw, she has no resources. CD? Broken Wings has 13s, 7.8s under 40% CD, effectively 4~5s depending on your Broken Wings follow-up timings; meanwhile her max level shielddash has 6/3.6s CD. CC? She has two.

So she doesn't pay for her mobility in damage, defensive skills, CC, Mana or cooldowns. She does have a lack of ranged attacks, and her HP regen is terrible. Her movement speed is 5 less than a lot of melee champions, and her armour isn't the greatest.

Champions who have those very same drawbacks don't necessarily have equal or more mobility than Riven, though, and often are limited by Mana costs.

I'm not saying Riven is overpowered (I don't think she is), but I'm always curious about what **trade-off** she has for her levels of mobility. I've never gotten a clear answer on just what champions are paying for their mobility.
If I had to guess maybe her low hp regen and in general lower base stats then other fighters? Truthful I'm not even sure if that's such a high cost for mobility.

Riven does actually pay for her mobility though, at least in the laning phase. Look at most popular toplaners atm. Most of them have at least some way to farm outside their meele-ranged autoattacks in case they're getting shoved in or poked down. 
Having to walk up to 125 range of the creeps to lasthit and not having any sustain to shrug off poke makes her reliant on her shield. Champions like Irelia or Renekton have a much easier time against ranged pokers like Lissandra or Kennen due to their sustain.  Olaf can just lasthit with axes, Mao has his Q and E to farm with at least some safety, even Fiora can pick up a few creeps with Riposte if she's getting out-traded.

Fiora has a lot of the same drawbacks but a lot of her damage is target agnostic(the beloved %hp true damage).

Obviously this becomes completely irrelevant once you get out of lane.

It's kinda funny when Evelynn players constantly whine about nerfs; when you have THE best jungling passive in the entire fucking game bar none, the rest of your kit has to pay heavily for it. Otherwise, she's pick or ban.

The point was that she pays for her strengths (stealth) by having major weaknesses in other areas.

Mobile champions don't pay for that mobility in the same way that she pays for her stealth.

Exactly. Who cares if she is relatively weak late game, she provides so much early pressure in the game just by being in the game. She doesn't even have to do anything, because the other team is hesitant to push or gank fearing she may be right there.

I'm not sure if all of them pay for mobility, for some like riven, Kata, yasou you can agrue that they pay through low base stats, other champions like fizz lose out a huge chunk of mana for there mobility spells, Kalista doesn't get a 1:1 ratio on her ad.

What if we could add items to the turrets? 

- Magic/armor pen(Counters tanks from just holding agro for a 10s teamfight). 
- Anti-Dash field(Counters turret diving assassins)
- The shield thing(Helps from being poked under turret)
- Turrets deal AoE damage every x attacks. Gives you 10% gold it gains from minion kills.(Helps when behind or cannot defend a lane as easily.)
- Turret attacks turn into a laser that adds a stacking slow to it's target(like a frost beam).(Helps counter a team from diving you.)
- Turret deal a close range AoE pulse at it's base every % of it's HP is lost. (Helps vs split pushing). 

You get the idea.

Garen, Darius, Yi, even the occasional support. The armor shred need to be higher, i am tired of just seeing a Garen or Darius with a half complete Sunfire walk under turret and kill me without a consequence. The champs arent OP the turrets are UP. I believe better armor shred and the anti mobility of turrets will work well together. But the snare or grounding shouldnt be so cheap that they die by just jumping out of turret range when taking down a turret. I believe if it is targeted at a living champ or directly after killing a champ it should be active. 

I believe that if it only works when certain things are met because if i am running away from a champ under a turret and i dash over a wall or i am taking down a turret and dash away as the last minion dies should all be open and viable.
